text: Rinse Zijlstra (19 April 1927 â€“ 26 September 2017) was a Dutch politician. He was born in Oosterbierum. His older borther was former prime minister Jelle Zijlstra. Zijlstra served in the House of Representatives from 1967 to 1973 as a member of the Anti-Revolutionary Party. Between 1975 and 1981, Zijlstra was mayor of Smallingerland. He was elected to the Senate between 1983 and 1995, representing the Christian Democratic Appeal, which had absorbed the Anti- Revolutionary Party in 1980. Zijlstra died in Beetsterzwaag of complications from Alzheimer's disease on 26 September 2017, aged 90. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Anti-Revolutionary Party politicians Category:Christian Democratic Appeal politicians Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Dutch Calvinists Category:Dutch mayors Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:Members of the Senate of the Netherlands Category:Politicians from Friesland
title: Rinse Zijlstra
